name: French Conquest of Algiers
obverse: War and Justice fly above a sea-monster (resembling a horse) representing Barbary seapower. This symbolizes the invasion of Algiers by France.
reverse: Inscription in five lines surrounded by a wreath.
reverse_inscriptions: LE COMTE DE BOURMONT, GÉNÉRAL EN CHEF DE L’ARMÉE FRANÇAISE
description: The French conquest of Algeria took place between 1830 and 1847. Algiers is the capital of Algeria and was quickly seized by the French at the onset of the fighting.
